entry.title: Upcoming Datacenter Upgrades
entry.summary: THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Sep 11, 17:00 UTC - Sep 19, 22:00 UTC Sep 2, 19:31 UTC Scheduled - Throughout the month of September 2021, we will be performing maintenance on various datacenters. Each window will be between 1am-6am local time of the data center. There is a possibility of a slight increase in latency during these maintenance windows. The most up-to-date schedule can be located here: Planned maintenance for Cloudflare data centers.

entry.title: Dashboard Maintenance

All dashboard UI actions will be unavailable during the window. Cloudflare's API and edge will be unaffected during this maintenance.

entry.title: Image Resizing Availability Issues
entry.summary: Sep 4, 22:04 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Sep 4, 17:55 UTC Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. Sep 4, 17:46 UTC Investigating - Cloudflare is investigating issues with Image Resizing the AVIF image format in some later versions of the Chrome browser, including but not limited to Version 93.0.4577.63. We are working to understand the full impact and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

entry.title: Argo Tunnel Creation Issues
entry.summary: Sep 3, 22:01 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Sep 3, 21:39 UTC Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Sep 3, 20:19 UTC Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. Sep 3, 20:14 UTC Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue. Sep 3, 20:09 UTC Investigating - Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Tunnel. Some users are reporting errors when attempting to add new IP/CIDR ranges to their Tunnel. This does not impact Tunnels with existing routes. We are working to understand and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

entry.title: Registrar operations partially degraded
entry.summary: Sep 3, 21:55 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Sep 2, 09:06 UTC Update - Our upstream provider is still undergoing a DDoS attack. We're working with them to mitigate this issue. Our system is still experiencing sporadic connection issues. If you have domains that expire in the next 48 hours, and you're unable to renew them, please contact our support for assistance. This incident doesn't affect domains that are set to auto-renew. If you have initiated a transfer, we're monitoring your requests. These orders will complete but updates in our system might be delayed because of this incident. Sep 1, 09:37 UTC Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues. Sep 1, 09:37 UTC Monitoring - One of our upstream providers is undergoing a DDoS attack and registrar operations are partially degraded.

entry.title: Connection issue with some registries
entry.summary: Sep 3, 15:59 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Sep 1, 11:44 UTC Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Sep 1, 11:39 UTC Identified - We are investigating slow response times on some registries You may experience issues querying domain availability status for these TLDs: nu, it, de, at, cz, lu, pl, es, im, cat, ru, nl, jp, se, pt, hn, ht, gs, sb, tl, mu, cx, am, hk, lt, gb.com, la, kr.com, ar.com, qc.com, uy.com, se.com, hu.com, no.com, no, af, nf, ki, pe, gy, ms, dk, lv, ph, nz, ro, xn--p1ai, si, mg, au, gr, cm, xn--j6w193g, xn--qxam

entry.title: Cloudflare Dashboard issues
entry.summary: Sep 3, 08:16 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Sep 3, 05:53 UTC Identified - Cloudflare has identified the issue and is implementing a fix. We will update the status once we implement the fix. Sep 3, 04:14 UTC Investigating - Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Dashboard for WAF. Some Customers Enabling WAF are impacted as they may not be able to enable it

entry.summary: Sep 2, 19:45 UTC Resolved - Cloudflare has resolved the issue and services have resumed normal operation. entry.title: New Data Center: Seoul (ICN)
entry.summary: Sep 2, 16:53 UTC Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Sep 2, 15:00 UTC In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Aug 31, 02:32 UTC Update - Please be advised that the billing region information has changed from Asia/Pacific to South Korea Aug 30, 23:46 UTC Scheduled - As part of Fastly’s global network expansion, we will be adding a Seoul, South Korea (ICN) data center to Fastly's Asia/Pacific network. Traffic served by our ICN data center will be aggregated into our South Korea region for billing and stats purposes. We expect that some traffic currently served by our data centers in neighboring regions will shift to ICN. As such, some customers may see a change in their bills. Fastly’s standard billing rates are located at https://www.fastly.com/pricing.

entry.title: Billing Region Changes: South Korea and South America
entry.summary: Sep 2, 16:00 UTC Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Sep 1, 16:02 UTC In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Aug 27, 19:33 UTC Update - Updated the body of post Aug 1, 04:24 UTC Update - Please be advised that the time of this maintenance event has changed from Aug 2nd, 16:00 UTC to Sep 1st, 16:00 UTC. Jun 15, 20:33 UTC Scheduled - As part of Fastly’s continuing network expansions, we’re excited to announce two changes to our billing regions: In preparation for upcoming Fastly Points of Presence (POPs), we are launching the new South Korea billing region. The South Korea billing region rates will be the same as our current Africa billing region rates for Fastly customers paying standard billing rates. For…

We still have some instability on this segment

entry.title: [Completed] .SG/.COM.SG REGISTRY SCHEDULED MAINTENANCE – September 4-5, 2021
entry.summary: Dear Customers, This is to let you know that the registry of .SG and .COM.SG domains will be processing scheduled maintenance. The time frame for the maintenance is as follows: September 4, 12:00 PM – 08:00 PM EST | September 4, 16:00 – September 5, 00:00 UTC Domain availability checks, registrations, renewals, updates, and WHOIS … Continue reading [Completed] .SG/.COM.SG REGISTRY SCHEDULED MAINTENANCE – September 4-5, 2021 → The post [Completed] .SG/.COM.SG REGISTRY SCHEDULED MAINTENANCE – September 4-5, 2021 appeared first on Namecheap Status.

We will provide updates as necessary. Aug 27, 08:49 UTC Scheduled - Our upstream registrar provider will be undergoing scheduled maintenance during this time. During this scheduled system maintenance, the following services may be affected by a service interruption and/or timeout: - domain registrations - domain renewals - domain transfers - domain updates updates DNS resolution will not be impacted, domains will continue to resolve as usual.

entry.title: Increased number of 5xx errors in Taipei
entry.summary: Aug 28, 06:00 UTC Resolved - Between 06:00-06:10 UTC customers reaching Taipei would have experienced an increased number of 5xx errors.

entry.title: Vanity Name Servers using legacy IPs outage
entry.summary: Aug 28, 01:04 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 28, 00:28 UTC Monitoring - Our legacy Vanity Name Servers IPs are accepting traffic back again. We are monitoring the implemented fix Aug 27, 23:54 UTC Identified - Our vanity name servers using legacy IP addresses are currently unavailable. Those IPs are: - 198.241.10.53 - 198.241.11.53 - 50.31.242.53 - 50.31.243.53 We are currently working on deploying a solution for it. Please notice that current vanity name servers using the current set of IP addresses are working as expected. https://support.dnsimple.com/articles/vanity-nameservers/

entry.title: Globalsign Intermediate Certificate Rotation
entry.summary: Aug 27, 22:04 UTC Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Aug 20, 23:19 UTC Update - The time for this to take place is: 9:30-10:00 UTC. Aug 17, 04:35 UTC Update - Please be advised that the time of this maintenance event has changed from Aug 24, entire day to Aug 24, 10:30 - 11:00 UTC. Aug 10, 00:53 UTC Scheduled - On August 24, 2021 GlobalSign will rotate their Atlas TLS CAs intermediate certificates. Beginning 2022, GlobalSign will start rotating their intermediate certificates on a quarterly basis, on the second Monday of every quarter. For customers who are using Fastly TLS managed certificates issued by GlobalSign, also known as Fastly TLS Commercial CA, this change will require action on your part if you are using certificate or public key pinning to avoid any impact to your traffic. For more information on the update from GlobalSign, please refer to the following links: https://www.globalsign.com/en/blog/upcoming-changes-publicly-trusted-tls-certificates https://support.globalsign.com/atlas/atlas-tls/atlas-tls-ica-rotations-2021

Aug 27, 14:44 UTC Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. Aug 27, 14:42 UTC Investigating - Network Performance Issues in India Cloudflare is investigating issues with network performance in India. We are working to analyse and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

entry.title: Upcoming Datacenter Upgrades

We will create a maintenance page for these once the dates are confirmed. Aug 3, 17:30 UTC In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Aug 3, 17:00 UTC Scheduled - Throughout the month of August 2021, we will be performing maintenance on various datacenters. Each window will be between 1am-6am local time of the data center. There is a possibility of a slight increase in latency during these maintenance windows. The most up-to-date schedule can be located here: Planned maintenance for Cloudflare data centers.

entry.title: Connection issues with registrar partner
entry.summary: Aug 26, 08:43 UTC Resolved - Connection to our registrar partner has been restored. Domain registration, transfer, and Sectigo SSL certificate issuance is operational. Aug 26, 08:24 UTC Identified - We're experiencing connection issues with one of our registrar partners. Domain registration, domain transfers, and Sectigo SSL certificates are impacted. DNS resolution is not impacted. Existing domains in our system are responding correctly.

entry.title: Issues with Account Membership Invites
entry.summary: Aug 25, 19:24 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 25, 18:48 UTC Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. Aug 25, 18:32 UTC Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue. Aug 25, 18:27 UTC Investigating - Cloudflare is investigating issues with Membership invites. User may encounter errors when accepting invites. We are working to resolve the issue. More updates to follow shortly.

entry.title: Increased HTTP 5xx Errors
entry.summary: Aug 24, 23:10 UTC Resolved - Cloudflare has experienced an increased level of HTTP 5xx errors from around 22:20 - 22:23 UTC in our ARN (Stockholm) data center

entry.title: Magic Transit Degraded Performance
entry.summary: Aug 24, 23:00 UTC Resolved - A retro incident has been declared related to Magic Transit. Impacted customers who have origin behind magic transit may see 530/522 in APAC region through Singapore data center. The impact of event is from 08-24 23:05 UTC to 08-25 01:13 UTC The impact has been mitigated.

entry.title: Fastly API Performance Issues
entry.summary: Aug 24, 22:22 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 24, 22:10 UTC Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Aug 24, 21:36 UTC Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. Aug 24, 20:53 UTC Update - Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue. Aug 24, 17:25 UTC Investigating - We are currently investigating performance issues affecting the availability of our API. CDN delivery, stats aggregation, and all other data plane services are unaffected.

entry.title: Configuration Propagation Performance Issues
entry.summary: Aug 24, 20:54 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 24, 19:27 UTC Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue. Aug 24, 19:08 UTC Investigating - We're currently investigating performance issues with edge cloud configuration propagation. All other services are unaffected.

entry.title: Network Performance Issues in TPE
entry.summary: Aug 24, 17:57 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 24, 14:36 UTC Update - We are continuing to monitor the situation regarding network performance in Taipei. Aug 24, 08:28 UTC Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Aug 24, 08:28 UTC Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. Aug 24, 06:36 UTC Investigating - Cloudflare is investigating issues with network performance in Taipei. We are working to analyse and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

entry.title: Cloudflare Dashboard issues
entry.summary: Aug 24, 03:47 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 24, 03:24 UTC Investigating - Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Dashboard. IP Access Rules page has a long button in Firefox which is preventing Firefox users to add new rules. Recommendation: Please use another browser like Safari, Chrome. These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge. Customers using the Dashboard are impacted as requests might fail and/or errors may be displayed.

entry.title: Network Analytics Delays
entry.summary: Aug 23, 10:06 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 23, 09:28 UTC Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Aug 23, 08:46 UTC Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. Aug 23, 06:20 UTC Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue. Aug 23, 06:18 UTC Investigating - Cloudflare is aware of, and investigating a delay with Network analytics. Further detail will be provided as more information becomes available.

entry.title: CDN Performance Impact
entry.summary: Aug 22, 09:36 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 22, 08:28 UTC Identified - We're currently investigating potential impact to performance with our CDN services.

entry.title: Cloudflare Dashboard IP access rule UI issue
entry.summary: Aug 21, 01:28 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 21, 01:04 UTC Investigating - Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Dashboard firewall IP access rule UI. Customer may experience pagination of IP access rule not fully display on the UI These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge. Customers using the IP access rule Dashboard are impacted, but customers can still use API to create IP access rules.

entry.title: Increased HTTP 502/504 Errors in ISB and LHE
entry.summary: Aug 20, 22:04 UTC Resolved - Cloudflare is investigating an increased level of HTTP 502/504 errors. Cloudflare has resolved the issue and services have resumed normal operation.

entry.title: TLS termination failures for some China customers
entry.summary: Aug 20, 20:17 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 20, 19:16 UTC Identified - Some China customers Edge requests are experiencing TLS Termination failures. The Cloudflare team has identified an issue and working on applying the fix.

entry.title: Fastly Control Plane Performance Issues
entry.summary: Aug 19, 21:52 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 19, 21:37 UTC Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Aug 19, 21:20 UTC Investigating - We are currently investigating performance issues affecting the availability of manage.fastly.com and our API. CDN delivery, stats aggregation, and all other data plane services are unaffected.

entry.title: Customer Impacting Issue
entry.summary: Aug 19, 19:34 UTC Resolved - Cloudflare has resolved the issue and services have resumed normal operation. Aug 19, 18:47 UTC Monitoring - A fix has been implemented, and we are monitoring the results. Aug 19, 18:37 UTC Identified - The issue has been identified, and a fix is being implemented. Aug 19, 18:31 UTC Investigating - Cloudflare is aware of, and investigating, an issue which potentially impacts multiple customers using Workers in our Toronto and Lisbon data centers. Further detail will be provided as more information becomes available.

entry.title: Emergency Network Maintenance
entry.summary: Aug 19, 02:00 BST Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Aug 18, 23:00 BST In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Aug 17, 14:49 BST Scheduled - During this maintenance period we will be making configuration changes to several core routers. We do not expect these changes to be service affecting however it should be considered an at-risk period.

entry.title: Generator Load Test
entry.summary: Aug 17, 16:00 BST Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Aug 17, 09:02 BST In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Aug 9, 14:40 BST Scheduled - During this maintenance window we will be performing a generator load test. This will involve transitioning from mains power to generators and then back again. We do not expect this to be service affecting however this should be considered an at-risk period.

entry.title: New Data Center: Ashburn (KIAD)
entry.summary: Aug 17, 05:41 UTC Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Aug 17, 05:00 UTC In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Aug 12, 04:56 UTC Update - We will be undergoing scheduled maintenance during this time. Aug 12, 00:23 UTC Update - Please be advised that the time of this maintenance event has changed from Aug 12, 05:00 - 11:00 UTC to Aug 17, 05:00 - 11:00 UTC. Aug 6, 12:45 UTC Scheduled - As part of Fastly's global network expansion, we will be adding a Ashburn, Virginia (KIAD) data center to Fastly's North America network. Traffic served by our KIAD data center will be aggregated into our North America region for billing and stats purposes. We expect that some traffic currently served by our data centers in neighboring regions will shift to KIAD. As such, some customers may see a change in their bills. Fastly’s standard billing rates are located at https://www.fastly.com/pricing.

entry.title: Traffic rerouted in Manila (MNL)
entry.summary: Aug 13, 02:54 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Aug 13, 01:20 UTC Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Aug 12, 14:44 UTC Investigating - Traffic in Manila (MNL) has been temporarily rerouted. All other locations and services are unaffected.

entry.title: New Cache Naming Schema
entry.summary: Aug 13, 00:00 UTC Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Aug 12, 00:00 UTC In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Aug 3, 06:10 UTC Scheduled - Fastly’s global network is growing, and with that growth comes changes and enhancements in some of our naming conventions and best practices. Refer to our server.identity and server.hostname pages on Developer Hub for an in depth explanation of the new cache naming schema. Starting no earlier than Thursday, 12 Aug 2021, we will begin populating the node name in some situations according to a new scheme. We’d like to share these changes so that if our customers are performing any troubleshooting or logging these values, one can not only know with certainty exactly what node processed a request, but also update any log parsing or automation to properly parse these values. Please note that for most of our existing infrastructure, the naming scheme is not changing, and you will continue to see these values set to the previous scheme for some of your traffic and log data. We suggest that if customers are parsing these fields out and breaking them down into individual values (such as the node name and POP) to adjust any tooling or automation to be able to handle both formats. Feel free to reach out to our support team if you have any questions on these changes. server.identity server.hostname

entry.title: Retroactive - Configuration Deployments
entry.summary: Aug 9, 22:49 UTC Resolved - Fastly Engineers detected a performance impacting event affecting the availability of VCL configuration deployments from approximately 2021-08-09 20:55 UTC to 2021-08-09 21:15 UTC. CDN delivery, stats aggregation, and all other data plane services were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and we are monitoring performance closely.
